channel.title: {PI} Help! Coders Please read thanks!
channel.description:
Hello, well I need a little help i will show you pic!
[img]http://i1235.photobucket.com/albums/ff433/GoodDeal15/omghelphelphelp.jpg[/img]
how do I remove that free quest and add something different...
Thanks

item.title: {PI} Help! Coders Please read thanks!
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:10, topic:427766”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530460.msg3873610#msg3873610 date=1325519920]

RSInterface, or you could use sendFrame126 server side to change it, but I’d suggest sticking with changing it client, via RSInterface like I said.

You’d suggest sticking to corrupting a cache?

LMFAO, you don’t even edit the cache you dumb fuck. Customizing the quest tab is a retarded idea anyways.

btw, I suggested doing it client side because that’s where it SHOULD be changed, having 1 code for text server side and 1 client side is retarded, when you can just have it in one place.

I never said that you edit the cache. This is from before we kissed and made up, so I guess we should agree to disagree. Hard-coding WILL corrupt a cache by the way.
[/quote]

Eh, hard coding text won’t corrupt a cache. :o

I’ve never corrupted a cache before, so I don’t know how. But it doesn’t even edit the cache, it just changes the words whenever the method is called.

P.S don’t you have to edit a cache to corrupt it? Lol :o[/quote]

It might’ve been the clients I’ve used, so you might be right. Also no you don’t have to edit a cache to corrupt it, you could edit text such as the NPC names, options, ect. Doing that would eventually corrupt the cache as well. The same goes for Objects and all other text.

Read full topic

P.S don’t you have to edit a cache to corrupt it? Lol :o
